meanings.sent1: The premold toy was ready to play with as soon as it was taken out of the box.
meanings.sent2: The premold plastic parts fit perfectly together without needing any adjustments.
meanings.sent3: The premold cake mix made baking so easy, even a beginner could do it.
meanings.sent4: Her premold smile never wavered, even in the face of adversity.
meanings.sent5: The premold building blocks clicked together effortlessly, creating a sturdy structure.

meanings.definition: To shape or form in advance
meanings.sent1: The company decided to premold the clay into basic shapes before the pottery class started.
meanings.sent2: She likes to premold the dough for the cookies the night before baking them.
meanings.sent3: He tried to premold his excuses for being late, but they still sounded unconvincing.
meanings.sent4: The artist's hands moved swiftly to premold the soft clay into a beautiful sculpture.
meanings.sent5: The chef would premold the pasta into different shapes before cooking them to perfection.
